source.8e80add8:
score_grouped = df.groupby("parental_level_of_education", as_index=True)[["math_score", "reading_score", "writing_score"]].mean().sort_values(by='writing_score',ascending=False)
score_grouped.plot.bar(title = "Students Score Average per Parental Level of Education", figsize=(20,10))

source.10184bc3: As you can see above, the males are good in Math than females. But females takes the lead in the other two subject which is writing and reading. We can also some difference on the score depending in the parent's educational status. Those students whose parents have Master's Degree have significantly better scores than the other students whose parents finished some high school.
